title: Jean-Marie Le Pen charged with embezzlement of EU funds
text:
Jean-Marie Le Pen, who worked as an MEP from the 1980s until earlier this year, was charged on Friday | Julien De Rosa/EPA-EFE Jean-Marie Le Pen charged with embezzlement of EU funds Far-right veteran denounces investigation into use of European Parliament money.

Jean-Marie Le Pen, the founder of France’s National Front, has been charged with embezzling public funds from the European Parliament to pay party staff in France.

Le Pen's estranged daughter Marine — the current head of the party, which has been renamed the National Rally — has already been indicted in the case, which allegedly involves millions of euros.

Jean-Marie Le Pen, who worked as an MEP from the 1980s until earlier this year, was charged on Friday, according to his lawyers.

Frédéric Joachim, a lawyer for the elder Le Pen, denounced the case as an "incursion of the judiciary into the legislature," adding that his client was "very tired of all this."

Two Paris judges questioned Le Pen, 91, for more than four hours about the jobs of three of his aides, his lawyers said.

“The investigating judges ask a lot of questions about a case that I consider a political scam,” Le Pen told Agence France-Presse. “It was very long."

The far-right politician will now be summoned to appear before the judges again on October 25, Le Monde reported.
description: Far-right veteran denounces investigation into use of European Parliament money.
